{"step_by_step_thinking": "The second mandibular molar typically begins to develop around the age of 12. At this stage, the crown of the tooth is usually complete, and the root has begun to form. The root is not fully formed yet, and the apex, or tip of the root, is still open to allow for further growth. The root is typically about 1/3rd to 1/2 of its final length at this stage.", "answer_choice": "A. Crown complete with 1/3rd root, open apex"}
